SEARCH
Package com.dua3.utility.options

Class AbstractOptionBuilder<T,B extends AbstractOptionBuilder<T,B>>

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.options.AbstractOptionBuilder<T,B>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the option value
B - the concrete builder type (for fluent interface)
Direct Known Subclasses:
FlagBuilder, OptionBuilder
public abstract class AbstractOptionBuilder<T,B extends AbstractOptionBuilder<T,B>> extends Object
Abstract builder for creating Option instances. Provides a fluent API for configuring and building Option objects.

  • Constructor Details

    • AbstractOptionBuilder

      protected AbstractOptionBuilder(@Nullable ArgumentsParserBuilder parserBuilder, String displayName, String description, Class<T> targetType)
      Constructs an instance of AbstractOptionBuilder with the specified arguments.
      Parameters:
      parserBuilder - the ArgumentsParserBuilder instance to associate with this builder, or null if no parser builder is needed.
      displayName - a user-friendly name for the option.
      description - a detailed description of the option's purpose or behavior.
      targetType - the Class object representing the target type to which the option will be mapped.

    • repetitions

      protected B repetitions(Repetitions repetitions)
      Sets the repetitions constraint for this option.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      this builder instance

    • repetitions

      public Repetitions repetitions()
      Retrieves the repetitions constraint for this option.

      The repetitions constraint specifies the minimum and maximum number of times the option can be provided. This is represented as a Repetitions record.

      Returns:
      the Repetitions constraint indicating allowed repetitions for this option

    • defaultSupplier

      protected B defaultSupplier(Supplier<@Nullable T> defaultSupplier)
      Sets the default supplier for the option. The default supplier provides a value when no explicit value is supplied for the option.
      Parameters:
      defaultSupplier - the supplier function to provide a default value, or null if no default value is needed
      Returns:
      this builder instance

    • isParameterSet

      protected boolean isParameterSet()
      Determines whether any parameters (required or optional) have been set for this option.

      The method checks if the required or optional parameters associated with the option are non-null and returns true if either is set.

      Returns:
      true if either required or optional parameters are set, otherwise false.

    • build

      public Option<T> build(String firstSwitch, String... moreSwitches)
      Builds and returns an Option with the specified switches and configurations. Validates the provided switches and automatically configures the option if applicable.
      Parameters:
      firstSwitch - the primary switch for the option
      moreSwitches - additional switches associated with the option
      Returns:
      a configured Option instance based on the provided parameters and configurations
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the required parameters or mapper function are not set
